column1: Colonel Paul Scott "Paco" Lockhart (born April 28, 1956) is a former American astronaut and a veteran of two Space Shuttle missions.
A test pilot for the F-16 aircraft, Lockhart was selected as an astronaut candidate in 1996.
Lockhart's two space missions, STS-111 and STS-113, both in 2002, were missions to the International Space Station.
He was assigned to STS-113 as pilot after the resignation of Christopher Loria from the NASA Astronaut Corps due to an injury.
After his service with NASA, Lockhart was assigned to and graduated in 2004 from the Royal College of Defence Studies in London, United Kingdom.
Lockhart retired from the U.S. Air Force in January 2007 and returned to NASA in an administrative position.
He is also a distinguished graduate of both ROTC and the Air Force Squadron Officer School.
